intro: Sonchus hantonionsis, commonly known as the Hantonion Island sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hantonion in the South China Sea. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, showing adaptations to saline and arid conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Sonchus hantonionsis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential for medicinal use.
